definitions.definition: To put an end to, especially with force, to crush, do away with; to prohibit, subdue.
To restrain or repress, such as laughter or an expression.
definitions.example: I struggled to suppress my smile.

definitions.definition: To exclude undesirable thoughts from one's mind.
definitions.example: He unconsciously suppressed his memories of abuse.
The government suppressed the findings of their research about the true state of the economy.

definitions.definition: To stop a flow or stream.
definitions.example: Hot blackcurrant juice mixed with honey may suppress cough.

definitions.definition: To forbid the use of evidence at trial because it is improper or was improperly obtained.
To reduce unwanted frequencies in a signal.
To hold in place, to keep low.
